sentences.english: His job was to drive a Red Cross truck carrying wounded away from battle.
sentences.chinese: 他在紅十字會的工作是駕駛卡車，將傷患帶離戰場。

sentences.english: The casualty should not be moved until help arrives.
sentences.chinese: 救援到達之前，不應該移動傷患。

sentences.english: Injuries are the most demotivating thing ever. ever.
sentences.chinese: 傷患永遠永遠永遠都是最讓人失去動力的事。

sentences.english: Professor wu and Qian Yuxiang to see wu min help to take care of the wounded in the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 吳教授和錢玉香去看在醫院幫忙照顧傷患的吳敏。

sentences.english: Learn appropriate methods for control of pain in patients with traumatic wounds.
sentences.chinese: 學習使用適當的疼痛控制方式使應用於外科傷患。

sentences.english: He was unlucky many times with long-term injuries but it helped him to mature.
sentences.chinese: 不幸運的是，他長期受困於傷患，但是這能讓他成熟。

sentences.english: He decided to withdraw from the game because of the painful injury.
sentences.chinese: 基於疼痛的傷患，他決定退出比賽。

sentences.english: Ferguson has had to overcome injuries to his team all season.
sentences.chinese: 費格遜領導的球隊整季都飽受傷患困擾。

definition: middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
